page.title: 17Moulton Crow Fair
page.content: The annual fair includes a dance performed by villagers called the Moulton Crows. Moulton Crows was started by Fred Jackson in the 1930's. The original Crow Dance was danced by the unemployed men for prize money. The dance itself has changed slightly but it is unique to Moulton. In the 1920's the Crow Fair was called Moulton Carnival. The Crow Fair is a very popular event there are games and books, cakes, sweets, bags, toys and lots more are sold. There are also games you can play like wet the cub, wet the scout, beat the goalie. It was held in the streets until 1979, it is now held on the school field. There are lots of people willing to help on the stalls, lots of organisations are willing to help and make it a day to remember.
